DOC.brief_summary: This trial is conducted in Europe and the United States of America (USA). The purpose of this study is to test whether insulin detemir is a safe and at least as effective alternative to insulin glargine for the control of blood glucose in basal/bolus therapy in patients with type I diabetes.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Insulin Detemir Plus Insulin Aspart Against Insulin Glargine Plus Insulin Aspart as Mealtime Insulin in Type 1 Diabetes
DOC.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
DOC.criteria: Type 1 diabetes for at least 12 months Current treatment with basalbolus insulin regimen for more than or equal to 3 months HbA1c less than or equal to 11.0% Proliferative retinopathy or maculopathy Recurrent major hypoglycaemia Impaired hepatic or renal function Cardiac problems or uncontrolled hypertension
